info.game_comments:
2002 College Championship semifinal game 1.
From the Schottenstein Center at the Ohio State University in Columbus.

(1, 1).clue: His diabolic plotting leads to tragedy for Othello & Desdemona

(2, 1).clue: 2-word term for the edible tuber of the genus Ipomoea that's very similar to a yam

(3, 1).clue: Reptoid, seen here, is this type of vehicle; the fangs might be a clue

(4, 1).clue: She married her boyfriend, cameraman Danny Moder, in a secret midnight ceremony on July 4, 2002

(5, 1).clue: I hope to train at Guy's Hospital in this world capital to become a better doctor -- & it's near some good pubs

(6, 1).clue: To scribble drawings aimlessly, usually while doing something else

(1, 2).clue: Cicero & Publius are senators in this tragedy

(2, 2).clue: Columbus native Buster Douglas was a 1990s champion in this sport dubbed "The Sweet Science"

(3, 2).clue: As a Red Cross volunteer in Italy during WWI Ernest Hemingway drove one of these vehicles

(4, 2).clue: This TV "Friend" won critical raves for her role as "The Good Girl" in a 2002 film

(5, 2).clue: I'm considering this Connecticut med school founded in 1810, but they make you write a thesis

(6, 2).clue: Seen here, this popular (comic) strip began in 1970

(1, 3).clue: It's the name of Romeo's family

(2, 3).clue: Suckle, moon & dew are often preceded by this sweet word

(3, 3).clue: Most commercial freight on the Mississippi travels in barges pushed by this type of boat

(4, 3).clue: In a 2002 blockbuster, he played both Peter Parker & your friendly, neighborhood Spider-Man

(5, 3).clue: When I was 12 I saved my brother by diagnosing the anaphylactic type of this when he got stung by a bee

(6, 3).clue: In the song "Camptown Races", it immediately follows "Camptown ladies sing this song..."

(1, 4).clue: King Claudius commissions these 2 minor characters, Hamlet's schoolmates, to spy on Hamlet

(2, 4).clue: According to the spiritual, one of these is "comin' for to carry me home"

(4, 4).clue: He played Will Freeman in "About a Boy", based on the book of the same name by Nick Hornby

(5, 4).clue: As a kid I thought this was a disease, instead of cell division that produces identical daughter cells

(6, 4).clue: Last name of Eliza, the Cockney girl in "My Fair Lady" whom Professor Higgins tries to turn into a lady

(1, 5).clue: Completes Dick the Butcher's "The first thing we do, let's..."

(2, 5).clue: Seen here, this insect is eagerly prized by ants for the sweet liquid it produces

(5, 5).clue: Organic chem is easy once you get this concept of an atom's combining capacity, also applied to some electrons

(6, 5).clue: Popular 20th century vocal style heard here

(1, 1).clue: Buckeye Archie Griffin, B.S. '76, is the only 2-time winner of this college football trophy

(2, 1).clue: In 1472 this island group known for its pony & sheepdog was annexed to Scotland

(3, 1).clue: This site's mission is "to help practically anyone trade practically anything on Earth"

(4, 1).clue: He wrote "The Fifth Quarter" under the name John Swithen, a musician at the prom in his novel "Carrie"

(5, 1).clue: Preceding "as thieves", it may come from thieves sticking together, or pickpockets sticking close to victims

(6, 1).clue: The jig is up when this instrument stops playing

(1, 2).clue: For his theory of element generation in nuclear reactions, William Fowler '33 won the Nobel Prize for this

(6, 2).clue: It's the heavy metal instrument of Caribbean origin heard here
